category_id: Trades and Subcontracts: Glass, Glazing, Windows, Tinting Bids
title: Service-Disabled Veteran-Owned Small Business (SDVOSB) Set-Aside (FAR 19.14): Roof Repair
description: THIS REQUEST FOR INFORMATION (RFI)/SOURCES SOUGHT DISCLAIMER This RFI is issued solely for information and planning purposes only and does not constitute a solicitation. All information received in response to this RFI that is marked as proprietary will be handled accordingly. Responses to this notice are not offers and cannot be accepted by the Government to form a binding contract. Responders are solely responsible for all expenses associated with responding to this RFI. The submission of pricing, capabilities for planning purposes, and other market information is highly encouraged and allowed under this RFI In Accordance With (IAW) FAR Part 15.201(e). SOURCES SOUGHT DESCRIPTION This is NOT a solicitation announcement. This is a RFI/sources sought only. The purpose of this sources sought/RFI is to gain knowledge of potential qualified sources and their size classification relative to NAICS 238150. Responses to this sources sought will be used by the Government to make appropriate acquisition decisions. After review of the responses to this sources sought, a solicitation announcement may be published. Responses to this sources sought synopsis are not considered adequate responses for a solicitation announcement. The Department of Veterans Affairs (VA), VISN 15 Network Contracting Office, is seeking sources that can provide the following: Repair Failing roof flashing on seams of roofing on Building 82 Install 20-inch-wide Pressure Sensitive ethylene propylene diene monomer over Approximately 400 feet of currently failing flashing. Clean approximately 400 feet of field seams. Install Pressure sensitive EPDM over the seam areas to cover up uncured flashing. Caulk cut edges to complete watertight barrier. All work and materials will be compliant with V.A. Master specification 07-53-23. Location: Marion, Veterans Affairs Medical Center, 2401 West Main St.? Marion Illinois. It is the responsibility of the interested source to demonstrate to the government that the interested parties can provide the supplies/services that fulfill the brand name. If you are interested, and are capable of providing the sought out supplies/services, please provide the requested information as well as the information indicated below. Response to this notice should include company name, address, point of contact, size of business pursuant to the following questions: Please indicate the size status and representations of your business, such as but not limited to: Service Disabled Veteran Owned Small Business (SDVOSB), Veteran Owned Small Business (VOSB), Hubzone, Woman Owned Small Business (WOSB), Large Business, etc.)? Is your company considered small under the NAICS code identified under this RFI? Does your company have an FSS contract with GSA, VA NAC, NASA SEWP, or any other federal contract, that can be utilized to procure the requirement listed above? If so, please provide the contract number. Please submit your capabilities that show clear, compelling, and convincing evidence that you can meet the requirement described in the attached SOW. Please provide your Unique Entity ID. Responses to this notice shall be submitted via email to Hubert Scipio at hubert.scipio@va.gov. Telephone responses shall not be accepted. Responses must be received no later than Monday, June 6th 2022 at 1000 CST. If a solicitation is issued it shall be announced at a later date, and all interested parties must respond to that solicitation announcement separately from the responses to this sources sought. Responses to this sources sought notice are not a request to be added to a prospective bidders list or to receive a copy of the solicitation

title: Wall Repairs
description:
The purpose of the project is to repair the masonry walls on the right side (southwest) and rear (southeast) if the building to provide waterproof, structurally sound, and aesthetically improved walls. The work includes, but not limited to, removal & re-pointing of deteriorated mortar as needed, removal and replacement of deteriorated caulk as needed, repair and/or replacement of loose or missing masonry as needed.
The City of Wilson will provide any brick needed for the project, otherwise, the contractor shall provide all materials, labor, and equipment to complete the project.

category_id: Trades and Subcontracts: Concrete, Granite, Masonry, Brick, Block Bids
title: Concrete Sinkers
description: This is a COMBINED SYNOPSIS/SOLICITATION for commercial items prepared in accordance with the information in Federal Acquisition Regulation (FAR) Part 13 using Simplified Acquisition Procedures (SAP). This announcement constitutes the only solicitation; a written solicitation will not be issued. PAPER COPIES OF THIS SOLICITATION WILL NOT BE AVAILABLE. This combined synopsis/solicitation will be posted to the System for Award Management at https://sam.gov/ and/or Procurement Integrated Enterprise Environment (PIEE) at https://piee.eb.mil. This is a combined synopsis/solicitation for commercial items prepared in accordance with the format in FAR 12.6, as supplemented with additional information included in this notice. The RFQ number is N5005422Q0080. This solicitation documents and incorporates provisions and clauses in effect though FAC 2022-06 and the DFARS Change notice 20220428. The Mid-Atlantic Regional Maintenance Center (MARMC) requests responses from qualified sources capable of providing the Concrete Sinkers that are identified in the attached Statement of Work (SOW). All parts shall be new. No refurbished or used parts will be accepted. See attached Combined Synopsis Solicitation for more information.?

title: Replace Duncan Exterior Delaminating Brick
description:
VWCC Replace Duncan Exterior Delaminating Brick

Status: Open
IFB 7809-1

Virginia Community College System - System Office -Virginia Western Community College, Roanoke, Virginia

Sealed bids are invited for the construction of Replace Duncan Exterior Delaminating Brick at Virginia Western Community College, Project Code # 260-B1260-064 (M21VW115), located in Roanoke, Virginia. The project is generally described as the demolition and replacement of two-story sections of face brick, insulation and masonry accessories, and one aluminum frame, with similar, updated materials. Sealed bids will be received at Virginia Community College System, Attention: Ms. Sibyl Roberts, 300 Arboretum Place, Suite 200, Richmond, Virginia 23236, Telephone (804) 819-4918. PLEASE NOTE: For shipping/mailing, use Suite 390; for hand delivery, use Suite 200. The deadline for submitting bids is 2:00 P.M. sharp, as determined by the Bid Officer, June 15, 2022. The bids will be opened publicly and read aloud beginning at 2:00 P.M., on June 16, 2022, at the same location. A Standard Commonwealth Bid Bond is required (form CO-10.2) and Contract Security is required for any bid regardless of bid amount. The bidder or offeror shall be a registered vendor in eVA.

title: Gateway Project
description:
The Town of Stallings will accept sealed bids for the construction of the Stallings Gateway Project located at the roundabout of Atrium Health Union West on Stallings Rd and Healing Way in Stallings, North Carolina 28104.
The Stallings Gateway project will include the fabrication and installation of an approximately 25 foot by 25 foot two-sided, internally illuminated gateway sign. Two additional standalone signs feature the Towns wordmark and are illuminated as well. Conduit was installed under Stallings Road during the recent construction of the roundabout; allowing for the contractor to bring water and electric to the sign.

category_id: Equipment: Transit, Subway, Trains, Buses, Ambulance, Fire Trucks Bids
title: Sources Sought: Emergency Rescue Unit
description: The DLA Aviation is issuing this sources sought synopsis as a means of conducting market research to identify parties having an interest in and the resources to support this requirement for a Rescue Unit, Emergen for NSN 1660- 01-421-0084. for an Estimated Annual Quantity of 2,000 each. IAW Essex Industries, Inc.;CAGE:19062; P/N: MR-10096AF and Essex Industries, Inc.; CAGE: 0U058; P/N: MR-10096AF. The required delivery schedule is 76 days. FOB Destination and Inspection and Acceptance is Origin.? The result of this market research will contribute to determining the method of procurement. The applicable North American Industry Classification System (NAICS) code assigned to this procurement is 336411. THERE IS NO SOLICITATION AT THIS TIME. This request for capability information does not constitute a request for proposals; submission of any information in response to this market survey is purely voluntary; the government assumes no financial responsibility for any costs incurred.? If your organization has the potential capacity to perform these contract services, please provide the following information: 1) Organization name, address, email address, Web site address, telephone number, and size and type of ownership for the organization; and 2) Tailored capability statements addressing the particulars of this effort, with appropriate documentation supporting claims of organizational and staff capability. If significant subcontracting or teaming is anticipated in order to deliver technical capability, organizations should address the administrative and management structure of such arrangements. The government will evaluate market information to ascertain potential market capacity to 1) provide services consistent in scope and scale with those described in this notice and otherwise anticipated; 2) secure and apply the full range of corporate financial, human capital, and technical resources required to successfully perform similar requirements; 3) implement a successful project management plan that includes: compliance with tight program schedules; cost containment; meeting and tracking performance; hiring and retention of key personnel and risk mitigation; and 4) provide services under a performance based service acquisition contract. BASED ON THE RESPONSES TO THIS SOURCES SOUGHT NOTICE/MARKET RESEARCH, THIS REQUIREMENT MAY BE SET-ASIDE FOR SMALL BUSINESSES OR PROCURED THROUGH FULL AND OPEN COMPETITION, and multiple awards MAY be made. Telephone inquiries will not be accepted or acknowledged, and no feedback or evaluations will be provided to companies regarding their submissions. Submission Instructions: Interested parties who consider themselves qualified to perform the above-listed services are invited to submit a response to this Sources Sought Notice by June 3, 2020 @ 3pm. All responses under this Sources Sought Notice must be emailed to Repanza Mason @ repanza.mason@dla.mil.???????????? If you have any questions concerning this opportunity please contact: to Repanza Mason @ repanza.mason@dla.mil.?????????????? APPENDIX 1: Purpose and Objectives NSN: 1660- 01-421-0084 Estimated Annual Demand Quantity: 2,000 each??? Minimum Delivery Order: 1,500 each Maximum Delivery Order: 2,000 each ?? Potential sources shall be capable of furnishing all labor, materials, facilities and equipment required to accomplish the new manufacture of the item(s).? Generally, this entails the procurement/manufacture of component parts, inspection, testing, preservation/packaging, and shipping.? Additionally, potential sources may be responsible for supply chain management, logistics planning, forecasting production requirements, long-lead time parts procurement, diminishing manufacturing sources and material shortage issues, and shipping serviceable assets.? The unit prices will be established at the time of a contract award. The specific requirement for this effort is below: Part Number 10096AF Nomenclature ?Rescue Unit, Emergen NSN 1660- 01-421-0084 Estimated Requirement 2,000 Technical Orders and Qualification Requirements are not available.

title: Auto Body Repairs and Painting Services
description: ADVERTISEMENT CITY OF SPRINGFIELD, MASSACHUSETTS OFFICE OF PROCUREMENT Invitation for Bids: Price Agreement for Auto Body Repairs and Painting Services for Police Vehicles City IFB No. 22-184 Bids will be received until 2:00 P.M.: June 2, 2022 by: THE OFFICE OF PROCUREMENT LAUREN STABILO, CHIEF PROCUREMENT OFFICER 36 COURT STREET, ROOM 307, SPRINGFIELD, MA 01103 PHONE (413)787-6284 FAX (413) 787-6295 at which time they will be publicly opened and read. Bid forms will be available on the City's website, www.springfieldcityhall.com on May 17, 2022, under the "Available Solicitations" tab. The Springfield Police Department is seeking to obtain a price agreement for Auto Body Repairs and Painting Services. Vendors must be fully registered as a motor vehicle repair shop defined under chapter 100A of the Massachusetts General Laws. The City intends to award up to Two (2) potential contracts to the lowest responsible and eligible bidder(s). The estimated value of the contract is not to exceed $100,000.00 per year. The initial term of the contract awarded is One (1) year in length, and the City will retain Two (2) one-year in length renewal options. This bid is subject to M.G.L. c.30B  5 and other procurement statutes. The City of Springfield supports the goal of twenty percent minority and women participation in all contracts. All questions regarding bid or its specifications must be received by the Office of Procurement no later than May 24, 2022 by 4:30 P.M. to Katie Vegh at kvegh@springfield cityhall.com . The Chief Procurement Officer/Designee reserves the right to waive any informality and to reject any or all bids if it is in the public interest to do so.

category_id: Services: Auto Repair, Custom Conversion, Towing Bids
title: On-Site Bus Inspection Services for Battery Electric Buses
description:
REQUEST FOR QUOTE (RFQ)

On-Site Bus Inspection Services for Battery Electric Buses with Post Award Financial Audits
Contract No.: V2137
Category: Services
Organization: Transdev Services, Inc. d/b/a NICE Bus
Manufacturing Location: New Flyer, 106 National Drive, Anniston, Alabama 36207
RFQ due Date and Time: 6/29/2022


Transdev Services, Inc. doing business as Nassau Inter-County Express (NICE Bus) is soliciting firm-fixed price bids from responsible firms for On-Site Battery Electric Bus (BEB) Inspection Services at New Flyer, 106 National Drive, Anniston, Alabama 36207 with Post Award Financial Audits. The bus order shall be for six (6) forty-foot BEBs manufactured in 2022-2023. And with up to two (2) Options for up to a total of thirty (30) buses, twenty (20) and ten (10) buses respectively, that may be exercised in 2024 and/or 2025. Contract term shall be for up to five (5) years from date of award.  The contract shall be awarded to the lowest, responsive and responsible bidder, and prices shall remain firm throughout the contract term.

Interested parties may express interest via mail or e-mail to the following: NICE Bus, 700 Commercial Avenue, Garden City, NY 11530; Attention: John French; e-mail: john.french@transdev.com. Please reference NICE Bus Contract No: V2137 in subject line.

Funding support for this procurement is provided through a financial grant from the Federal Transit Administration (FTA). In accordance with 49 Code of Federal Regulations (CFR) Part 26, participation of Disadvantage Business Enterprises (DBE) in all aspects of this federally funded contract will be encouraged and supported.
Offerors are encouraged to utilize the services of minority and DBE-owned banks, and other financial institutions, when such institutions are available. Information about such institutions owned and controlled by economically and socially disadvantaged individuals can be requested from the Nassau County Office of Minority Affairs, at One West Street, Third Floor, Mineola, NY 11501 offices.

category_id: Services: Auto Repair, Custom Conversion, Towing Bids
title: Maintenance and Repair for the PAMSP Motorcycles
description: The Pennsylvania Department of Transportation (PennDOT) is seeking bidders for this Invitation for Bid (IFB) to provide basic maintenance, repairs and reporting on motorcycles owned by the Pennsylvania Motorcycle Safety Program (PAMSP) as described in the ?Tasks? section of this Statement of Work (SOW) document.   PennDOT is seeking a vendor to provide a certified inspection mechanic with a valid motorcycle license to perform a broad array of basic repair, maintenance, inspection and quality assurance check services for its fleet of motorcycles both in the field and stored.   This bid solicitation has been reserved for Small Business Contracting.  Only those Bidders certified as DGS Small Businesses through the Small Business Contracting Program may submit a bid for these services. Information on qualifying as a DGS Certified Small Business can be found at:  https://www.dgs.pa.gov/Small%20Business%20Contracting%20Program/Pages/default.aspx  The term of this project will be one (1) year with the option of four (4) one-year renewals.  All quantities are estimated.   BIDS WILL ONLY BE ACCEPTED ELECTRONICALLY.  Due to the current COVID pandemic, this conference will take place via a Microsoft Teams meeting. The Conference will be held on May 26, 2022 @ 10:00 AM via Microsoft Teams meeting. An RSVP is due via email to James Alwine, jaalwine@pa.gov, by May 25, 2022 @ 3:00 PM. The link to the Microsoft Teams call, or call in phone# and code for those without Microsoft Teams access, will be provided after registration.

category_id: Infrastructure: Signalization, Barricades, Barrels, Post, Poles, Related Bids
title: Airfield Lighting Vault Relocation
description:
he Contractor shall provide the necessary labor, materials, supplies, and equipment to install:

One (1) concrete block (CMU, vapor barrier and insulation, and veneer block construction) airfield lighting vault building (approximately 70 ft x 100 ft; 7000 sq. ft)
Approximately 30 ft wide bituminous apron surrounding building
Approximately 20 ft wide vehicle service roads
Site excavation, site work grading, and storm water remediation as required
Underground duct back conduits with counterpoise and associated manholes/handholes for incoming power, fiber optic communication, airfield lighting circuitry, and outgoing power to the 28 De-Ice Pad.
Cabling and fittings/connectors as required to connect power and airfield circuits
Copper and fiber optics cabling to connect the communications loop through the airfield.
Standby generator with internal day tank and external fuel tank with piping, fittings,  and pumps, as required.
480 V power distribution equipment and associated hardware
Cable trays, conduits, cabling, and fittings/connectors as required interior to the ALV.
Switchgear style constant current regulators and Airfield Lighting Control and Monitoring System upgrades as required
Building automation, fire protection, telecommunications, and security systems with associated hardware as required.
Two (2) 15kV external switches with foundations
Two (2) 1500kVA utility step down transformers with foundations

title: Traffic Signal Upgrades
description: INVITATION FOR BIDS CORAOPOLIS BOROUGH Coraopolis Borough will receive bids for the Green Light Go Traffic Signal Upgrades project at the following intersection: Montour Street and State Avenue Bids will be received until 10:00 a.m. on Tuesday, June 21, 2022 by Coraopolis Borough, 1301 Fourth Avenue, Coraopolis, PA 15108. All envelopes containing bid proposals shall be clearly marked "CORAOPOLIS BOROUGH TRAFFIC SIGNAL UPGRADES". Bids will be publicly opened and read aloud at that time. Copies of the Bidding Documents may be obtained at the office of Trans Associates Engineering Consultants, Inc., Suite 400, 4955 Steubenville Pike, Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania 15205, upon a non-refundable payment of $50.00 for each set of plans and specifications. A certified check or bank draft payable to the order of the Coraopolis Borough, or a satisfactory Bid Bond executed by the Bidder and an acceptable surety, in an amount not less than ten percent (10%) of the total bid shall be submitted with each bid. All bids must be submitted on a lump sum basis. Coraopolis Borough reserves the right to reject any and all bids or to waive any informality in the bidding. Bidders must be pre-qualified by the Pennsylvania Department of Transportation and submit proof thereof with their bid. Bidder shall comply with all state and federal laws prohibiting discrimination in hiring or employment opportunities. Pennsylvania prevailing minimum wage rates will apply. Bids may be held by Coraopolis Borough for a period not to exceed forty five (45) days from the date of opening of Bids for the purpose of reviewing the bids and investigating the qualifications of Bidders prior to awarding the Contract. Coraopolis Borough Ray McCutcheon, Manager

category_id: Infrastructure: Signalization, Barricades, Barrels, Post, Poles, Related Bids
title: Traffic Signal Maintenance
description: A. ADVERTISEMENT Notice is hereby given that Northampton Township will accept sealed proposals for Traffic Signal Maintenance. Bids will be accepted until 2:00 PM on Thursday June 9th, 2022 via PennBid (PennBid. ProcureWare.com) only. All bids received will be evaluated for completeness. Bid Documents are available online at no charge via PennBid. The bids will be reviewed by the Township and their agents and scored in accordance with the criteria detailed in Section B.11 of the bid document. The contract will be before the Board of Supervisors for consideration of award at their public meeting on June 22, 2022 or at a subsequent meeting of the Board. All bidders are required to establish proof of competency and responsibility, in accordance with PennDOT Form 408/2016, Change 6, Section 102. Subcontractors must pre-qualify in the same manner, if listed in the proposal, or if they subsequently undertake the partial or total construction of one or more items of work. All bidders must include staff who are IMSA Traffic Signal Technician Level II certified or higher to perform maintenance and construction of traffic signals. Bidders must also have experience maintaining Peek and McCain traffic control equipment. Bidders are required to submit references of present and/or past municipalities where Peek and McCain equipment and systems are current and have been maintained. Northampton Township reserves the right to reject any or all proposals, or parts thereof, for any cause whatsoever, as they deem in the best interest of Northampton Township. BY ORDER OF THE BOARD OF SUPERVISORS NORTHAMPTON TOWNSHIP By: Robert Pellegrino, Township Manager

category_id: Consulting: Planning and Transportation Analysis Bids
title: DownTown Pedestrian and Bicycle Connectivity Study
description: The City of Stockbridge (City) is seeking proposals from a qualified firm(s) for the purpose of completing the Livable Centers Initiative (LCI) study. The work to be accomplished is in accordance with the Livable Centers Initiative (LCI) program. Stockbridge has an LCI study, which was updated in 2012. The City also has an updated Comprehensive Plan (2018), Bicycle, Pedestrian and Trail Plan (2017), and a Downtown Renaissance Strategic Vision & Plan (RSVP). This concept study will compile recommendations from each of these publications. The Citys intent is to develop a complete study that cover a 0.8-mile segment of the downtown area of Stockbridge including US 23 from East Atlanta Rd to Burke St.; Burke Street from US 23 to Davis Road; Love Street from Burke St to East Atlanta Road, Jim Clark Dr. from MLK Sr. Heritage Trail to Burke Street; MLK Sr. Heritage Trail from Lovejoy Street to Jim Clark Dr.; Lovejoy Street from Burke St. to MLK Sr. Heritage Trail.

category_id: Consulting: Planning and Transportation Analysis Bids
title: Organizational Assessment
description: Bids will be received by the City of East Point Purchasing Department, until Friday, May 27, 2022 @ 3:30pm. Late bids will not be accepted. No submitted proposals may be withdrawn after the scheduled closing time or receipt of proposals for a period of one hundred twenty (120) days. The City of East Point is requesting qualifications (RFP) from a professional organizational management consultant firms or individuals to submit Statement of Qualifications for an organizational/operational assessment/audit of its organizational structure, as well as its staffing levels, staffing distribution, and customer service levels  legal, procedural, and operational. A mandatory pre-proposal conference is scheduled for 11:00am, Tuesday, May 17, 2022. The formal solicitation package may be obtained by visiting the Citys web site located at www.eastpointcity.org . Solicitation documents cannot be obtained in person from the City nor by mail, email, fax, or courier service. eBids shall be received on behalf of the City until 3:30 P.M. on Friday, May 27, 2022 in the Contracts and Procurement Office, 2757 East Point Street 1st Floor, East Point, Georgia 30344.

category_id: Consulting: Planning and Transportation Analysis Bids
title: RFQ for Heritage Park Master Plan, Alley Streetscape Design, and Wayfinding Signage Design
description:
Request For Qualifications For Professional Services For Town Center: Reuben A. Knoblauch Heritage Park Master Plan, Alley Streetscape Design, And Wayfinding Signage Design (May 2022)
CITY OF SUMNER

REQUEST FOR QUALIFICATIONS FOR PROFESSIONAL SERVICES FOR

DEVELOPMENT OF (1) THE REUBEN A. KNOBLAUCH HERITAGE PARK MASTERPLAN (2) HERIGATE PARK ALLEY FINAL DESIGN AND (3) CITYWIDE WAYFINDING SIGNAGE POSTS

The City of Sumner is requesting interested consulting firms submit a Statement of Qualifications for development of a Master Plan for the Reuben A. Knoblauch Heritage Park (Heritage Park), final design plans, specifications, and estimate for alley streetscape near Heritage Park between Kincaid Avenue and Alder Avenue, and signpost design for wayfinding signs to be located throughout the city. The work under this phase will include, but is not limited to, public outreach, development of engineering drawings, specifications, and cost estimates.  The services are anticipated to commence in Summer 2022. For future phases of the projects, the selected firm could be retained for design, construction contract bid documents and construction support if the city is successful in obtaining grant funding or chooses to move forward with local funds. 

The City of Sumner reserves the right to amend terms of this Request for Qualifications (RFQ), to circulate various addenda, or to withdraw the RFQ at any time, without liability to any interested or responding firm, regardless of how much time and effort consultants have spent on their responses.

The City of Sumner reserves the right to retain the services of responsive firm(s) for subsequent phases associated with this project.

Prospective consultants will be held to Federal EEO requirements for federally funded projects and to the ADA and Civil Rights language adopted by the City of Sumner.

Project Description

The City of Sumner recently adopted the Sumner Main Street Visioning Plan.  That plan identified improvements to Sumners Main Street including to Heritage Park, the Ryan House, the alleys, and Main Street. 

Heritage Park: Consistent with the Main Street Visioning Plan, Heritage Park will expand from its current footprint to be approximately 0.75 acres, the full block. Streetscape around Heritage Park is being constructed in 2022/2023, but the park itself has not been recently master planned to truly serve as the heart of the city both during events and every day. 

Alley Activation: The Main Street Visioning Plan identified a need to upgrade and better utilize the current alleys as multipurpose areas. In addition to their current role for transportation/accessing businesses, they will be developed as gathering spaces for pedestrian walkways, events, and other pop-up uses. Through this project, the alley between Kincaid Avenue and Alder Avenue will be developed to shovel-ready construction plans that also set a broad design for all other alleys.

Wayfinding Signs: The city needs to upgrade signs that direct drivers to key areas and public parking. This package also reworks signage for public parking lots to clearly identify them. The city already has a graphic design package for this project. This portion will take graphic design and design the final sign elements (posts, materials, etc.) to prepare this project for a sign shop to construct.

The consultants tasks may include, but are not limited to public outreach, survey, geotechnical work, civil design, lighting design, cultural resources, traffic impact analysis, and ROW acquisition as needed to develop the Master Plan and alley design with potential phasing, including engineering drawings, specifications, cost estimates, preparation of bid-ready construction contract documents and construction management/support.  WSDOT standard specifications and Sumner Development Standards serve as the basis for City of Sumner contracts. Project specifications shall be completed in WSDOT format.

The Master Plan and alley design may include a community center, stage, playground, plaza, sound system, lawn space, picnic areas, lighting, permanent parking, restroom facilities, walkways, landscaping, and other amenities.  Requirements for frontage or other improvements will be determined through the design process and included in the corresponding phases of development.

The city desires to include Green Stormwater Infrastructure, utilizing permeable pavements and bioretention to the maximum extent practicable.

Upon award of the contract, the consultant shall propose a project schedule with completion of the alley design by December 31, 2022, to meet grant requirements.

The consultant will coordinate with the Citys Communications Division before developing any outreach to efficiently align any project efforts with the Citys ongoing communications. Typical efforts include but are not limited to updating the Sumner Connects project page, gaining feedback at the Citys open house(s), providing clear information for newsletter, e-newsletter and social media.  See Communications/Engagement Consultants Guide for Success.

A package of supplemental information is available through a link at the project website https://connects.sumnerwa.gov/main-street-visioning-plan, or by contacting Derek Barry at derekb@sumnerwa.gov.

description: Naval Special Warfare Command (NSW), Contracting Department, intends to award a Firm Fixed Price Contract for design, project management, and refurbishment services at Naval Special Warfare Assessment Detachment (NSWD), Command Building 616.? Objectives:? This contract shall provide services as identified in this SOO to include: Refurbish, upgrade, modernize identified Building 616 spaces highlighting NSW history and capabilities. Provide an Interior Designer or team to plan, design, project manage, and upgrade the spaces identified. Provide all required materials and products, not otherwise provided by the Government as defined in the SOO that correspond with the design. This includes, but is not limited to; visual displays, equipment and display cases, replica model boats/weapons, rugs. Facilitate the placement, delivery, and installation of products related to the refurbishment and design. This may include appropriate lighting for the displays. Coordinate with the Contracting Officer?s Representative (COR) on Government furnished memorabilia, content of visual displays, and creation of models/displays.? Coordinate through the COR with the NSW historian, facilities personnel, and other stakeholders, as needed, to ensure project accuracy, efficiency, and project success. Completion of the project is anticipated to be No Later Than (NLT) 30 November 2022. The requirement will be acquired in accordance with Federal Acquisition Regulation (FAR) Part 12, Acquisition of Commercial Items and FAR Subpart 13, Simplified Acquisition procedures.? The contract will include a base CLIN 0001 with a Not To Exceed (NTE) amount of $130,000. Performance will be Naval Amphibious Base (NAB) Coronado, CA.? The applicable North American Industry Classification System Code is 541410. Potential contractors are hereby notified that the solicitation and subsequent amendments to the solicitation will ONLY be available for download at the above sites; this office will no longer issue hard copy solicitations. By submitting an offer, the offeror is self-certifying that neither the requestor not the principal corporate officials and owners are currently suspended, debarred, or otherwise ineligible to receive contrast from any federal agency. Failure to do so may represent grounds for refusing to accept the offer. By submission of an offer, the contractor acknowledges the requirement that a prospective awardee must be registered in the System for Award Management (SAM) database prior to award, during performance, and through final payment of any contract resulting from this solicitation, except for awards to foreign vendors for work to be performed outside the United States. Lack of registration in the SAM database will make a contractor ineligible for award. Contractors may obtain information on registration and annual confirmation requirements via the internet at https://www.sam.gov/SAM/ Please direct all questions regarding this requirement via e-mail to the POC identified in this synopsis.

title: BROAD AGENCY ANNOUNCEMENT (BAA) for Extramural Biomedical Research and Development - W81XWH-18-S-SOC1
description: This BAA is intended to solicit extramural research and development ideas using the authority provided by United States Code, Title 10, Section 2358. This BAA is issued under the provisions of the Competition in Contracting Act of 1984 (Public Law 98-369), as implemented in Federal Acquisition Regulation 6.102(d) (2) and 35.016 and in DoD Grant and Agreement Regulations (DoDGARs) 22.315. In accordance with FAR 6.102, projects funded under this BAA must be for basic and applied research to support scientific study and experimentation directed toward advancing the state-of-the-art or increasing knowledge or understanding rather than focusing on development of a specific system or hardware solution. Research and development funding through this BAA are intended and expected to benefit and inform both military and civilian medical practice and knowledge. This BAA provides a general description of USSOCOM's research and development programs, including research areas of interest, evaluation?and selection criteria, pre-proposal/pre-application and full proposal/application preparation instructions, and general administrative information. Submission of a pre-proposal/pre-application is required. After review, if the USSOCOM is interested in receiving a full proposal/application, the Applicant or Offeror will be invited to submit a full proposal or full application. Specific submission information and additional administrative requirements can be found in the document titled "General Submission Instructions" available in Grants.gov along with this BAA The BAA is continuously open for a 5-year period, from 01 August 2018 through 31 July 2023, at 11:59 p.m. Eastern Time. Submission of a pre-proposal/preapplication is required and must be submitted through the electronic Biomedical Research Application Portal (eBRAP) (https://eBRAP.org/). Preproposals/pre-applications may be submitted at any time throughout the 5-year period. If the USSOCOM is interested in receiving a full proposal/application, the Principal Investigator will be sent an invitation to submit via eBRAP. A full proposal/application must be submitted through Grants.gov (http://www.grants.gov/). Invited full proposals/applications can be submitted under this BAA through 31 July 2023. The BAA with revised research areas of interests, and General Submission Instructions will be available for download on Grants.gov on 16 May 2022. Search opportunity number W81XWH18SSOC1.

description: THIS IS A Sources Sought Notice ONLY.? The U.S. Government desires to procure Interior Design Services to include design, fabrication, and installation of graphic, digital, and/or physical interpretive displays and exhibits to include digital exhibits, outdoor physical signs, labels, mounts and other exhibit supporting items and materials at Arlington National Cemetery (ANC) to include the Multi Purpose Room in the Welcome Center. Services include the design, fabrication and installation of exhibit components, exhibits, signs, museum labels, artifact mounts, interpretive displays, and digital exhibits. ??On a small business set-aside basis, provided 2 or more qualified small businesses respond to this sources sought synopsis with information sufficient to support a set-aside.? Be advised that the U.S. Government will not be able to set aside this requirement if 2 or more small businesses do not respond with information to support the set-aside.? We encourage all small businesses, in all socioeconomic categories (including, 8(a) Business Development Program, Small Disadvantage Business, Historically Underutilized Business Zone, Service-Disabled Veteran-Owned, Women-Owned Small Business concerns), to identify their capabilities in meeting the requirement at a fair market price. This notice is issued solely for information and planning purposes ? it does not constitute a Request for Quote (RFQ)/Invitation for Bid (IFB)/Request for Proposal (RFP) or a promise to issue an RFQ, IFB or RFP in the future.? This notice does not commit the U.S. Government to contract for any supply or service.? Further, the U.S. Government is not seeking quotes, bids or proposals at this time and will not accept unsolicited proposals in response to this sources sought notice.? The U.S. Government will not pay for any information or administrative costs incurred in response to this notice. Submittals will not be returned to the responder.? Not responding to this notice does not preclude participation in any future RFQ or IFB or RFP, if any is issued.? If a solicitation is released, it will be synopsized on the System Award Management (SAM) https://www.sam.gov or sam.gov. It is the responsibility of potential offerors to monitor the System Award Management (SAM) https://www.sam.gov or sam.gov for additional information pertaining to this requirement.? The anticipated NAICS code(s) is/are:? 541410, Interior Design Services, with a size standard of $8M. Responses to this Sources Sought Notice shall be e-mailed to the Contract Specialist, Edward Faison, at edward.k.faison.civ@army.mil with a with a courtesy copy (cc) to Oswald Pascal, Team Lead, at oswald.pascal.civ@army.mil, no later than 13 June 2022 at 12:00 p.m. Eastern Standard Time. In response to this sources sought, please provide: Name of the firm, point of contact, phone number, email address, DUNS number, CAGE code, a statement regarding small business status (including small business type(s)/certifications(s) such as SDB, 8(a), HUBZone, SDVOSB, WOSB, etc.) and the corresponding NAICS code. Identify whether your firm is interested in competing for this requirement as a prime contractor or not.? Identify subcontracting, joint ventures or teaming arrangement that will be pursued, if any. Information in sufficient detail regarding previous experience (indicate whether as a prime contractor or subcontractor) on similar? requirements (include size, scope, complexity, timeframe, government or commercial), pertinent certifications, etc., that will facilitate making a capability determination. The capability packages for this sources sought are not a proposals, but rather statements regarding the company?s existing experience in relation to the areas specified above. No solicitation mailing list will be compiled.? No phone calls will be accepted.? Capability packages shall not exceed five (5) pages. Please review the attach Performance Work Statement.

category_id: Business Events, Expos, Matchmaking Bids
title: 2022 Tobyhanna Army Depot Virtual Industry Day
description: SAVE THE DATE!!! TITLE OF EVENT:? 2022 Tobyhanna Army Depot Virtual Industry Day AUDIENCE:? Industry Representatives, Prospective Vendors, and Large and Small Business with a focus on service and supply related industries. MISSION:? Tobyhanna Army Depot is a recognized leader in providing world-class logistics support for Command, Control, Communications, Computers, Cyber Intelligence, Surveillance and Reconnaissance (C5ISR) Systems across the Department of Defense (DoD). The Depot's Corporate Philosophy, dedicated workforce and electronics expertise ensure the depot is the Joint C5ISR provider of choice for all branches of the Armed Forces and our industry partners. Tobyhanna's unparalleled capabilities include full-spectrum support for sustainment, overhaul and repair, fabrication and manufacturing, engineering design and development, systems integration, technology insertion, modification, and global field support to our Warfighters. WHEN:? Thursday, June 16, 2022, commencing at 9:00 a.m. (ET) WHERE:? Virtual - Microsoft Teams.? Here is the link to the event: https://dod.teams.microsoft.us/l/meetup-join/19%3adod%3ameeting_fd24771b426e4b46a6a1bbd44fed7592%40thread.v2/0?context=%7b%22Tid%22%3a%22fae6d70f-954b-4811-92b6-0530d6f84c43%22%2c%22Oid%22%3a%2247fb212e-a7f6-475b-9009-08c71a5e5ae0%22%2c%22IsBroadcastMeeting%22%3atrue%7d Cut and paste the entire link into your web browser or click on the link.? When prompted, join the event through your web browser by clicking WATCH ON THE WEB INSTEAD.? Do not attempt to join through the Teams app. TOPICS:? Event agenda is under development and will be posted soon. REGISTRATION:? Attendees are encouraged to register and registration is free.? Here is the link to the event registration form: ? https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSd1-VTQ3-wCUGp3dLxupeIcnpoF-Ztu4iunzKpiwHDjCCZwFg/viewform?usp=sf_link Cut and paste the entire link in to your web browser or click on the link.? Click SUBMIT at the bottom of the form when completed. DESCRIPTION:? Tobyhanna Army Depot invites businesses to attend the 2022 Tobyhanna Army Depot Virtual Industry Day on Thursday, June 16, 2022 starting at 9:00 a.m.? The purpose of this forum is to provide our industry partners an avenue to learn about the mission of Tobyhanna Army Depot and to encourage an open dialogue and exchange of information and ideas.? Industry will hear from the organization?s leadership and gain insight of Tobyhanna?s strategic and operational objectives.? The forum will also educate industry how to do business with us and learn about upcoming contract opportunities.? The audience will be able to submit questions through the chat. Agenda topics include contract opportunities through Installation Services, Mission Operations, and through Computers, Hardware, Enterprise Software Solutions (CHESS).? Attendees will also learn how to provide supplies to the Depot through the Base Supply Center and what we purchase by credit card.? ? As an event precursor, please find the attached the latest ACC-APG Tobyhanna Division FY22 Fair Opportunity Forecast. POINT OF CONTACT:? If you have any questions regarding the event or this public notice, please send an email to Mr. David Kern, Small Business Professional, david.k.kern2.civ@army.mil.? Please reference Industry Day in the subject line.

title: 2022 Army Intelligence and Security Enterprise Industry Day June 16, 2022
description: SAM.gov AISE Industry Day Announcement with Registration Info: Notice ID: W50NH906162022 https://sam.gov/opp/ef3d67b375f042ccb82bc8829f42a9a6/view Published Date: Mar 29, 2022 2022 Army Intelligence and Security Enterprise Industry Day? June 16, 2022 The Department of the Army G-2 and U.S. Army Intelligence and Security Command (INSCOM) will host an unclassified, 2022 Army Intelligence and Security Enterprise Industry Day on Thursday, June 16, from 8:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m (EDT). The event will be held simultaneously in-person and virtually via web conference. During registration, prospective participants must select whether they prefer to participate virtually via web conference or in-person at the National Geospatial-Intelligence Agency (NGA) Campus East in Springfield, Virginia. We will do our best to honor the method of participation selected by registrants. However, due to in-person capacity limits, some registrants who prefer to attend in-person could be solely approved to participate virtually. We will approve registrants to attend in-person on a first-come, first-served basis. Further, if COVID restrictions prevent an in-person event, then a virtual-only event will occur on the same day and time. We will notify participants as soon as possible if they are approved for in-person or virtual attendance and will send additional administrative info about the event about a week out. The event will include panels on Army Intelligence and Security Enterprise (AISE) Modernization Priorities and an Integrated Approach to Intelligence, Surveillance and Reconnaissance (ISR) Modernization, as well as a session on Army G-2 and ISR Task Force S&T Focus Areas and Enterprise Modernization. The event will also include information on technologies needed, as well as projected contract solicitations from INSCOM. Participants will include Industry vendors and government representatives from DA G-2, INSCOM, Army Futures Command (AFC), PEO Intelligence, Electronic Warfare and Sensors (IEW&S), Intelligence Center of Excellence (ICOE), Assured-Positioning, Navigation and Timing (A-PNT) Cross Functional Team (CFT), Long-Range Precision Fires (LRPF) CFT, Future Vertical Lift (FVL) CFT, Network CFT, Army Contracting Command (ACC), and other government organizations. A security clearance is not required for participation. Notes: A security clearance is not required for participation. Cost: There is no charge for attendance. Lunch is at each attendee's own expense. NGA offers multiple dining options for lunch including a cafeteria and various fast food establishments for each attendee to choose from. We do not accept sponsors for the event. Registration. To attend, you must register no later than June 2, 2022 at: https://einvitations.afit.edu/inv/anim.cfm?i=662620&k=0467400F7957 Based on the number of registrants and space available, we may limit companies to a determined number of attendees or may need to close registration earlier than the RSVP date listed. We will not accept late or substitute registrations. You must register by RSVP (see link below) with your official company / government email address. We will not accept registrations that use private email addresses. All information related to the 2022 AISE Industry Day, including registration information, will be posted at:? https://www.inscom.army.mil/Contracting/industry.aspx ? Submit any questions to the Industry Day Support Team, usarmy.belvoir.inscom.mbx.industry-day@army.mil Information Concerning In-person Participation: Uniform:?Business attire for civilians; Duty uniform / ACUs for military Identification. To gain access to the event at NGA, on the day of event, you must present a?REAL ID?compliant identification card, valid (not expired) U.S. passport, common access card (CAC), or Intelligence Community (IC) badge. If the event occurs virtually, a Webconference system for the event will be announced before the event. An event link will be sent to approved registrants. If the event is held virtually, we will not accept log-ins that use a private email address. COVID Guidelines: COVID precautions for the event will be based on NGA guidelines and the Center for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) COVID-19 community level for Fairfax County, VA (county NGA is in) at the time of the event. Before the event, we will inform approved attendees of other precautions that may be required. The following are the COVID guidelines currently in place. Vaccination Certification. All attendees, regardless of vaccination status, will be required to provide a signed DD Form 3150, Contractor Personnel and Visitor Certification of Vaccination, which can be downloaded a the following link, signed in advance, and brought to the event:?https://www.esd.whs.mil/Portals/54/Documents/DD/forms/dd/dd3150.pdf Masking and Testing Guidelines: If Community Level is low: Masks NOT required (regardless of vaccination status) Testing NOT required (regardless of vaccination status) If Transmission Level is Medium: Masks NOT required (regardless of vaccination status) Testing:?Personnel who are unvaccinated or who have not attested to being fully vaccinated, must provide official documentation of a negative COVID test administered by a professional testing site within 72 hours of arriving at NGA (that is, the test must be administered no earlier than 13 June 22 at 0800 EDT). If Transmission Level is high: Masks are required?(regardless of vaccination status) Testing:?Personnel who are unvaccinated or who have not attested to being fully vaccinated, must provide official documentation of a negative COVID test administered by a professional testing site within 72 hours of arriving at NGA (that is, the test must be administered no earlier than 13 June 22 at 0800 EDT). The CDC COVID-19 community level for Fairfax County, VA (county NGA is in) can be found at?https://www.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/your-health/covid-by-county.html ******You must be registered to attend****** Primary Point of Contact.: Industry Day Support Team usarmy.belvoir.inscom.mbx.industry-day@army.mil ?

category_id: Equipment: Petroleum, Fueling Stations, Bulk Station and Terminal Bids
title: Police Department Fueling Facility
description:
103005 - Police Department Fueling Facility
June 15, 2022, 3:00 PM

A NON-MANDATORY Pre-Bid Meeting will be held at
The Lake Havasu City Police Department Office at 2360
McCulloch Blvd. North, Lake Havasu City Council Chambers,
Lake Havasu City, AZ 86403 on May 26, 2022 at 1 pm local
time.

This project consists of removing two fuel underground storage tanks (USTs) and installing
two above ground fuel tanks (ASTs). The USTs stored gasoline and diesel fuel and have
capacities of 12,000 gallons and 2,500 gallons respectively. The new ASTs will be 12,000
gallons of gasoline and 2,000 gallons of diesel capacity.
ENGINEERS ESTIMATE: $435,000
QUESTIONS: All questions that arise relating to this solicitation shall be directed in
writing to purchasing@lhcaz.gov. To be considered, written inquiries shall be received at
the above-referenced email address by June 3, 2022, 3:00 p.m. Arizona Time.
Inquiries received will then be answered in an Addendum.
Sealed bids for the project speci fied will be received by the City Clerk's Office, 2330 N.
McCulloch Boulevard N., Lake Havasu City, Arizona, 86403 until the time and date
stated. Bids received by the correct time and date will be opened and read aloud
immediately thereafter in Room 109 of Lake Havasu City Hall. Public openings may
be attended virtually by accessing the following video conferencing system:
To join the meeting on a computer or mobile phone:
https://bluejeans.com/2330864044?src=calendarLink
Meeting ID: 233 086 4044
Phone Dial-in
+1.408.740.7256 (US (San Jose))
+1.888.240.2560 (US Toll Free

title: Quotes for Gasboy Dispenser Service & Repair
description:
The City of Pasadena requests bids from an Authorized Gasboy vendor to provide service and repair to Gasboy dispensers at four fuel sites. Services to include, but are not limited to: replacement of unleaded and diesel dispenser hoses; maintain dispensers and all related accessories; and repair of various leaks around the Gasboy dispensers. The prospective bidder will supply all the necessary parts and labor needed to complete this service. Bid to include labor rate, parts mark-up, warranty and mobile service rates.

Grace Wu 626-744-4401
gwu@cityofpasadena.net

category_id: Infrastructure: Climate Change, Environmental Remediation, Green Energy, Solar Bids
title: Bids for Hydrogeologic Exploratory Boring
description:
One (x1) 600-foot deep exploratory borehole to be drilled at the City of Santa Monica (City) Michigan Avenue city yard located at 2500 Michigan Ave, Santa Monica, CA 90404.

The area is paved and used for parking and vehicle traffic. The exploratory borehole is to be drilled using a direct mud rotary drill rig. After completion of downhole testing, the borehole shall be permanently destroyed.

The primary purpose of this exploratory borehole is to generate the subsurface data needed to provide an evaluation of drilling a future water injection well at this site.

Pre-Bid Job Walk will be required. 

Denise Mixon
Senior Buyer
1685 Main Street
Mail Stop 09
Santa Monica, CA 90401
Email: denise.mixon@smgov.net
Phone: (310) 458-2211

category_id: Infrastructure: Climate Change, Environmental Remediation, Green Energy, Solar Bids
title: RFI for EV Charging Station
description:
San Francisco International Airport (SFO or Airport) is issuing this Request for Information (RFI) to identify firms that can finance, develop, maintain, and operate one or both of the following facilities:  

1)	A minimum of 14 Direct Current Fast Charging (DCFC) EV Charging Stations that are a minimum of 250kW capable. 
2)	Convenience Center, to include a convenience store (mandatory), along with other options, which may include, but are not limited to (and which are subject to the approval of the Airport) quick-serve food & beverage (F&B) options, other shop options, and indoor and/or outdoor seating area for customers.  

Respondents may respond either to only (1) above, or to (1) and (2), but not to (2) only.    

Please review the attachments for this opportunity. 
RFI - Battery Electric Vehicle Charging Station and Convenience Center

Online Pre-Submittal Conference: 
Date: 5/19/22
Time: 1:00 p.m. 

Attendance for the Pre-Submittal conference is optional but recommended.  Proposers are encouraged to attend the conference. Please email Erin Cooke at Erin.Cooke@flysfo.com with the names of the attending firm and all interested attendees name and email address, no later than 3:00 p.m. (PST) on May 17, 2022.
Event ID: SFGOV-0000006960

title: Subcontractors Needed: Pavement Reinforcing Fabric
description:
A. Teichert & Son, Inc. dba Teichert Construc


An Equal Opportunity Employer,


is requesting quotations from all qualified


WBE,MBE


sub-contractors and material suppliers for the following project:



2021 Greenback Lane Complete Streets Improvements Project



City/Location: Citrus Heights, CA


County: Sacramento



Owner: City of Citrus Heights



Bid Date: Tuesday 12/20/2022 at 3:00 PM



We are requesting bids for the following trades and/or supplies:


Teichert Construction is requesting quotes from all qualified subcontractors and suppliers including certified MBE/WBE firms for the following items of work, including but not limited to: all materials, labor and equipment for CONSTRUCTION AREA SIGNS, TRAFFIC CONTROL SYSTEM, RESET, ADJUST ROADWAY ITEMS, PLANE ASPHALT CONCRETE, CLEARING & GRUBBING, EROSION CONTROL, AGGREGATE BASE, ASPHALT CONCRETE, PAVING ASPHALT (ASPHALT CONCRETE), PAVEMENT REINFORCING FABRIC, RECYCLE, RECLAIM ASPHALT CONCRETE, MINOR CONCRETE STRUCTURE, ALTERNATIVE PIPE CULVERT, REINFORCED CONCRETE PIPE, PLASTIC PIPE, CONCRETE CURB & SIDEWALK- MISC, SURVEY OR HISTORICAL MONUMENT, THERMOPLASTIC TRAFFIC STRIPING & MARKING, LAND SURVEYING, CUTTING, SAFETY EQUIPMENT SUPPLIER, PETROLEUM, OIL, LUBRICANTS SUPPLIER (BULK ITEM), ASPHALT SUPPLIER(BULK ITEM), PIPE SUPPLIER, DRAINAGE SYSTEMS SUPPLIER, STORM WATER SYSTEMS SUPPLIER, PAVEMENT MARKERS SUPPLIER, ELECTRICAL & SIGNALS SUPPLIER, TRAFFIC STRIPES, MARKING AND TRAFFIC CONTROL MATERIALS SUPPLIER, MATERIAL TESTING SERVICES, LAND SURVEYOR, LEAD COMPLIANCE, SWPPP PLANNING, BOTTOM DUMP TRUCK, TRANSFER DUMP TRUCK, SUPER 10 DUMP TRUCK, WATER TRUCK, END DUMP TRUCK, STREET SWEEPING TRUCK and TRUCKER BROKER.



NAICS Classifications
Sector 23--Construction
All Other Specialty Trade Contractors
Other Heavy and Civil Engineering Construction



CSI Classifications
DIVISION 1 - GENERAL
TRUCKING-HEAVY HAULING
TRUCKS -- DUMP/TRAILERS
DIVISION 2 - SITE WORK
CONCRETE CURBS/GUTTERS
CONCRETE PIPE
PAVING/SURFACING
SIGNAGE
TRAFFIC SIGNALS



Bid documents can be viewed at or obtained from:


Docs & Plans Available from https://www.citrusheightsplanroom.com/



Request for qualified bids from Subcontractors, Suppliers & Truckers for the following project:
Project: 2021 Greenback Lane Complete Streets Improvements Project ? City of Citrus Heights 

Docs & Plans Available from https://www.citrusheightsplanroom.com/
Estimate: $2,400,000 Duration: 90 working days Agency Goals: 16.1% MBE and 6.9% WBE 
Teichert Construction intends to work cooperatively with all qualified firms seeking work on this project, including but not limited to breaking out contract work items into economically feasible units to increase overall MBE/WBE participation. Plans and specifications are available from the municipality listed above and the Teichert?s Roseville Estimating office. For assistance obtaining or regarding the plans and specifications, please contact the listed Estimator.

100% Payment and Performance Bonds for subcontractors are required. Teichert will pay bond premium up to 2%. Insurance Waiver of subrogation also required. However, certified MBE/WBE's are encouraged to contact Teichert and request assistance if they are unable to meet Teichert's standard bonding or insurance requirements. MBE/WBE's also are encouraged to contact Teichert for assistance in obtaining lines of credit, equipment, supplies, materials or related assistance or services. Subcontractor, Supplier and Trucker quotes must be valid, at minimum, for the award period stated in the contract documents. Please note that this is a prevailing wage project and Teichert Construction is Union signatory. Subcontractors will be subject to the terms and conditions of Teichert's subcontract and safety documents available at www.teichert.com/for-subcontractors.cfm. Submission of a bid to Teichert will confirm that you have reviewed and accepted Teichert's subcontract form. Conditions or exceptions in Subcontractor?s quote are expressly rejected unless accepted in writing prior to bid. Subcontractor scopes and supplier quotes are required 24 hours prior to bid. Additional information and or assistance to MBE/WBE's available from: *** All Subcontractor Quotes must have the Department of Industrial Relations # to be ACCEPTED ***




A. Teichert & Son, Inc. dba Teichert Construc


400 Sunrise Avenue, Suite 300


Roseville, CA 95661


Phone: (916) 757-6400  Fax: (916) 757-6499


John Gale


estimating@teichert.com

category_id: Supplies: Textile, Curtains, Fabric, Drapery, Tarp and Flag Bids
title: One Man Tent
description: The U.S. Army Product Manager Soldier Clothing and Individual Equipment (PM SCIE) is conducting a market research investigation for individual-Soldier tents/shelters. The goal of this effort is to identify firms with capabilities to provide modular one-man shelters for use by Soldiers operating in a range of environments.? Interest is in readily available products or developmental items capable of being in production within four (4) months of the close of this RFI (must be based on a concise and attainable development/commercialization plan). Required technical capabilities for the individual-Soldier shelter are as follows: Provide shelter from rain and wind in environments ranging from basic cold through hot without leaking and/or collapsing. Provide room for the 95% male Soldier to lay down and put a rucksack inside. Include ventilation and insect protection. Minimize weight. Provide 120 combat-days of service life. Maximize pack-ability. Be easily set up, torn down, and packed in near/total darkness. Other desired technical capabilities include: Be capable of multiple configurations to include standard configuration providing one-man stand alone, pole supported or pin and pole supported tent; and combined configuration that allows additional room for multiple soldiers when combined with one or more additional individual shelters. All configurations will minimize visual signature and profile. All configurations minimize near, short-wave, mid-wave, and long-wave infrared signature (750nm to 12?m) Be strong enough and capable of functioning as tarp and expedient litter. Interested sources shall, within thirty (30) calendar days of the publication of this RFI, respond with information on their current product(s) and how they address the requirements listed above. The information package shall contain the following items: General information regarding the firm, including location, size, and special designations (i.e. 8(a), Women-Owned Small Business, etc.). Information regarding the firm's production capabilities for the submitted item(s), to include whether the item(s) can be domestically produced in compliance with Section 2533a of Title 10 U.S. Code (i.e. the ?Berry Amendment?). Retail and/or wholesale pricing for currently available products. A detailed description of the product, to include specs and information regarding the materials utilized. Test reports confirming performance claims, if available. Monthly production capacity. Delivery schedule for any potential future orders. Willingness to provide Government Purpose Rights (to include parts list, materials used and patterns) and associated costs. Willingness to partner with an AbilityOne Non-Profit Agency for production of assets under the Federal Procurement List (FPL). A product sample may be submitted if available.? If a firm chooses to submit samples, no payment will be made by the government for such samples. Responses to this notice are to be sent to: 10 General Greene Ave. ATTN: Robert Drown D207 Natick, MA 01760-5000 This notice is for market research only. ?This is not a request for quotations. ?No solicitation document exists. ?The information received under this announcement may be used to purchase items for Government testing (including laboratory and Soldier evaluations) and determine a future procurement strategy. ?You may email your questions for PM SCIE to the points of contact listed below. Point of Contact(s): Robert Drown, robert.e.drown.civ@army.mil CPT Ryan Ogden, ryan.s.ogden.mil@army.mil

title: Total Small Business Set-Aside (FAR 19.5): Stage Curtains
description: THIS IS A COMBINED SYNOPSIS/SOLICITATION for commercial services prepared in accordance with the format in FAR Subpart 12.6, as supplemented with additional information included in this notice. This announcement constitutes the only solicitation: quotes are being requested and another written solicitation will not be issued. Solicitation number M0026322Q0024 is issued as a request for quote (RFQ) using the commercial procedures in accordance with FAR Part 12 and 13. The Source Selection procedures are in accordance with FAR 13.106-1(a)(2), Price and Other Factors. The solicitation document and incorporated provisions and clauses are those in effect through Federal Acquisition Circular 2021-01 and DFARS Publication 20200929. The Regional Contracting Office, Marine Corps Recruit Depot- Parris Island, SC intends to solicit and award a Firm Fixed Price Contract for Stage Curtains aboard the Marine Corps Recruit Depot, Parris Island, SC.? This solicitation is issued as 100% small business set aside and the North American Industrial Classification System (NAICS) code for this requirement is 314120 with a size standard of 750 (numbers of employees). All applicable Federal Acquisition Regulation (FAR) and Defense Federal Acquisition Regulation Supplement (DFARS) provisions and clauses are contained in SF 1449 M0026322Q0024 attached to this synopsis. The Government will answer questions received up to (31 May 2022) prior to the solicitation closure and will provide responses to interested parties via an amendment to the solicitation.? All questions shall be in writing.? Questions received after this date may not be answered. Offerors responding to this announcement shall submit their quotes in accordance with FAR Part 12 and additional instructions, conditions, and notices to offerors provided in the SF1449.? The provision at 52.212-1, Instructions to Offerors -- Commercial, applies to this acquisition and its addendum provision. Comparative Evaluation/Basis for Award (a) The Government will award a contract resulting from this solicitation to the responsible offeror whose offer conforming to the solicitation will be most advantageous to the Government, price, past performance, and other factors considered. The following factors shall be used to evaluate quotes: Price; Past Performance:? The apparent successful, prospective contractor must have satisfactory or neutral past performance.? Past Performance shall be evaluated in accordance with FAR 13.106-2.?? The Supplier Performance Risk System (SPSR) application (https://www.sprs.csd.disa.mil) will be used in the evaluation of suppliers? past performance in accordance with DFARS 213.106-2(b)(i). Other Factors: Contractor?s quoted supplies or services shall, at a minimum, meet the salient characteristics, specifications, deliverables, or performance requirements outlined in the solicitation. In accordance with FAR 13.106-2(b)(3), the government will conduct a comparative evaluation of quotations based on price and other non-price factors.? The Government will first eliminate unacceptable quotations; the remaining quotations will be arranged from lowest price to the highest price.? If there are more than two (2) quotes, the Government will conduct a comparative assessment of at least the two (2) lowest price quotes.? The award will be made to the offeror?s whose quote is determined to have both a fair & reasonable price and to be the most advantageous to the Government. (b) A written notice of award or acceptance of an offer, mailed or otherwise furnished to the successful offeror within the time for acceptance specified in the offer, shall result in a binding contract without further action by either party. Before the offer?s specified expiration time, the Government may accept an offer (or part of an offer), whether or not there are negotiations after its receipt, unless a written notice of withdrawal is received before award. Offerors shall include a completed copy of the provision at 52.212-3, Offeror Representations and Certifications -- Commercial Items, with its offer.? Clause at 52.212-4, Contract Terms and Conditions -- Commercial Items, applies to this acquisition.? All other additional contract requirement for this acquisition can be found in the attached SF 1449 Site Visit: A site visit is not mandatory. In order to attend the site visit, contact the Contract Specialist, Terrence Wideman at terrence.wideman@usmc.mil no later than May 31, 2022 to confirm interest and intent to attend site visit. If you plan to attend the site visit please send all attendings full name, date of birth, drivers licence number and the state of issue. The site visit will be June 6, 2022 at 1:00 PM Eastern. The closing date and time for this solicitation is June 10, 2022 at 11:00 AM (EDT). The primary point of contact for this solicitation is Terrence Wideman (terrence.wideman@usmc.mil).

category_id: Supplies: Textile, Curtains, Fabric, Drapery, Tarp and Flag Bids
title: Maritime Vessel Stopping Occlusion Technologies (MVSOT) Support
description: ??????????? The Naval Surface Warfare Center Panama City Divisions intends to issue a modification to the previously awarded sole source contract to Utah State University (USU), 2300 Old Main Hill, Logan, UT 84322, (CAGE code: 4B969 USU) extending the period of performance from 36 months (12/19/2019-12/18/2022) to 60 months (12/19/2019-12/18/2024) to develop synthetic bio-inspired materials for propeller occlusion, including but not limited to spider silk thread, spider silk sponges, hagfish slime proteins, and hagfish slime intermediate filaments for Maritime Vessel Stopping Occlusion Technologies (MVSOT).? USU will synthetically reproduce natural spider silk and hagfish slime proteins, then process into spider silk thread, spider silk-based sponges, and hagfish slime intermediate filaments for propeller occlusion applications.? USU will provide subject matter expertise on bio-inspired materials and synthetic production of bio-inspired materials.? This contract action will include an additional two (2) Options of 12 months each.? This procurement is sole source for the following reasons. ? ?USU is the only responsible source capable of providing the required material in the required schedule.? Under the current contract N61331-20-D-0001, USU successfully synthesized and provided support for synthetic hagfish slime proteins, synthetic hagfish intermediate filament fiber, synthetic spider silk and synthetic spider silk-based sponges for propeller occlusion under Maritime Vessel Stopping Occlusion technologies (MVSOT). ? This acquisition is of previously developed and highly specialized materials.? This effort builds upon previous contract efforts and seeks to progress the technology by scaling up production to larger quantities for in-water testing.? USU has decades of experience developing synthetic spider silk proteins; this experience is unique in the bio-inspired materials industry and directly allowed USU to successfully reproduce synthetic hagfish slime proteins in lab scale quantities.? Given the complexity of the materials and the level of program knowledge required for non-lethal vessel stopping, USU is the only source possessing the requisite expertise, internal technical data, equipment, and experienced personnel necessary to successfully provide the engineering, production, and quality of service to accomplish all tasking. ? The Navy has previously contracted material research and development support from the Utah State University under contract FA8075-14-D-0014.? This contract is for the continued research and development support of USU to further refine and produce spider silk and hagfish slime filaments and yarn using transgenic silk worms as well as bacterial production and goat?s milk expression of spider silk and hagfish slime proteins.? For another contractor to develop the necessary knowledge, expertise and inherent technical data to perform this service at an acceptable material performance level would take several (4-5) years at a minimum.? This notice of intent to negotiate a sole-source action is not a request for competitive proposals.? A determination by the Government not to compete this action based upon responses to this notice is solely within the discretion of the Government.? All responsible sources may submit a response, which will be considered.? All responses should be directed to maximillian.a.moore.civ@us.navy.mil and must be received within fifteen (15) days from the publication date of this synopsis or by COB 4:00 P.M. CDT 15 June 2022.? NAICS 325220.? Small Business Size Standard is 1,000 employees.? PSC AC34.

title: Total Small Business Set-Aside (FAR 19.5): Tentage for Kauai, Hawaii
description: This is a Sources Sought and does not constitute a request for proposal or offers. This information is used for market research purposes only. The Army Contracting Command, Regional Contracting Office - Hawaii REQUEST FOR INFORMATION 1.0 Description 1.1 U.S. Army Pacific seeks a contractor capable of providing up to 30 fabric tents (approximately 16 x 32 ft) for occupancy at the Hawaii Pacific Missle Range Facility from 2 July - 4August 2022. We are seeking information on interested contractor's capability in providing tents with incidental services of transportation, setup, and removal of tent sets. 1.2 THIS IS A REQUEST FOR INFORMATION (RFI) ONLY. This RFI is issued solely for information and planning purposes - it does not constitute a Request for Proposal (RFP) or a promise to issue an RFP in the future. This request for information does not commit the Government to contract for any supply or service whatsoever.? Further, Army Contracting Command is not at this time seeking proposals and will not accept unsolicited proposals. Respondees are advised that the U.S. Government will not pay for any information or administrative costs incurred in response to this RFI; all costs associated with responding to this RFI will be solely at the interested party's expense. Not responding to this RFI does not preclude participation in any future RFP, if any is issued. If a solicitation is released, it will be synopsized on the Federal Business Opportunities (FedBizOpps) website. It is the responsibility of the potential offerors to monitor these sites for additional information pertaining to this requirement. 2.0 Responses 2.1 Interested parties are requested to respond to this RFI by email. 2.2 Responses are due no later than 03 June 2022 2022, 12:00 pm Hawaii Time. Responses shall be limited to a five (5) page capability statement submitted via e-mail only to scott.w.voigt2.mil@army.mil 2.3. The email response shall provide administrative information, and shall include the following as a minimum: 2.3.1. Name, mailing address, overnight delivery address (if different from mailing address), phone number, fax number, and e-mail of designated point of contact. 2.3.2. Recommended contracting strategy. 2.3.3. Business type (large business, small business, small disadvantaged business, 8(a)-certified small disadvantaged business, HUBZone small business, woman-owned small business, very small business, veteran- owned small business, service-disabled veteran-owned small business) based upon North American Industry Classification System (NAICS) code 314910 ?Textile Bags and Fabric Mills -- "Small business concern" means a concern, including its affiliates that is independently owned and operated, not dominant in the field of operation in which it is bidding on Government contracts, and qualified as a small business under the criteria and size standards in 13 CFR part 121. 3.0 Industry Discussions ACC representatives may or may not choose to meet with potential offerors. Such discussions would only be intended to get further clarification of potential capability to meet the requirements. 4.0 Questions Questions regarding this announcement shall be submitted in writing by e-mail to the scott.w.voigt2.mil@army.mil. Verbal questions will NOT be accepted. Questions will be answered by posting to the FBO Website; accordingly, questions shall NOT contain proprietary or classified information. The Government does not guarantee that questions received after June 3, 2022 will be answered. 5.0 Summary THIS IS A REQUEST FOR INFORMATION (RFI) ONLY to identify sources that can provide Collapsible Water Jugs identified requirements. The information provided in the RFI is subject to change and is not binding on the Government. DLA has not made a commitment to procure any of the items discussed, and release of this RFI should not be construed as such a commitment or as authorization to incur cost for which reimbursement would be required or sought. All submissions become Government property and will not be returned.

title: Faircloth Study and Related Consulting Services
description:
RFP # 2028-01 Faircloth Study and Related Consulting Services

The Boston Housing Authority (BHA) is seeking real estate development consultant services from one or more qualified individuals or firms with significant experience in development feasibility studies, financial modeling, project management including financing and permitting applications, and strategic planning for Public Housing Authorities (PHAs). The BHA is exploring the feasibility of expanding its subsidized housing portfolio. The value of the work is estimated to $100,000.00. The term of the contract shall be one (1) year and may be extended for an additional one (1) year at the sole option and request of BHA. Please see the Request for Proposal (RFP) for more details.  RFP packages may be obtained free of charge via email request only to bids@bostonhousing.org. Proposers responding to this RFP are required to submit one (1) original and six (6) copies of their proposal and shall provide one (1) electronic copy of the non-fee portion of their proposal on CD-R or DVD-R media, or USB flash stick to the BHA, Contract Office, 6th FL., 52 Chauncy St., Boston, MA 02111 by 2:00 PM on Monday, June 13, 2022 by mail or hand delivery.  There will be no bidders/Proposals conference. Questions or requests for modifications regarding this RFP will be accepted in writing only until 2:00 p.m. on 05/31/2022 and must be submitted to Joel Wool, BHA Chief Procurement Officer at 52 Chauncy St., Boston, MA 02111 or by email to bids@bostonhousing.org. The BHA reserves the right to make multiple awards, reject any proposals, and waive any informalities if it be in the public interest to do so.
